title: FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Chess Championships 2024: Carlsen announces shock withdrawal; Arjun, Harika, Humpy among leaders after Day 2 - ESPN India
summary:
Carlsen Withdraws from 2024 FIDE World Rapid & Blitz Championships Amid Dress Code Controversy

Published on: Dec 28, 2024, Source: ESPN

Magnus Carlsen has withdrawn from the World Rapid & Blitz Championships due to a dress code issue, leading to a reshuffle in the leaderboard where Arjun Erigaisi, Harika Dronavalli, and Koneru Humpy emerge as leaders.

Key Points

  • Carlsen faced a $200 fine and refused to change attire, resulting in his withdrawal.
  • Volodar Murzin leads the Open championship, followed closely by Arjun Erigaisi and others.
  • Harika Dronavalli and Koneru Humpy topped the Women's division after eight rounds.
  • Carlsen expressed frustration with FIDE, stating a desire to distance himself from the organization.
"I am pretty tired of FIDE, so I want no more of this. I don't want anything to do with them." - Magnus Carlsen

FIDE responded by emphasizing the need for adherence to established dress code regulations for professionalism.

Conclusion

The incident has sparked discussions around player treatment and organizational policies in professional chess.
newTitle: Carlsen Withdraws from 2024 FIDE World Rapid & Blitz Championships Amid Dress Code Controversy

title: Just one session of exercise can keep your brain supercharged till the next day - The Times of India
summary:
Just One Session of Exercise Can Supercharge Your Brain Until the Next Day

Publication Date: [Insert Date] | Source: [Insert Source]

A recent study by University College London reveals that only one session of exercise can enhance memory benefits for over 24 hours. This emphasizes the importance of physical activity not just for physical health, but also for cognitive enhancement.

  • The study involved 76 participants aged 50 to 83 engaging in moderate to vigorous physical activity.
  • Memory tests showed improved performance the day after exercising.
  • Participants reported less sitting time and more deep sleep, contributing to memory improvement.
  • This research uses a unique “micro-longitudinal” study design, tracking daily activities of participants.
  • Findings were published in the International Journal of Behavioral Nutrition and Physical Activity.
“Our findings suggest that the short-term memory benefits of physical activity may last longer than previously thought, possibly to the next day instead of just the few hours after exercise,” Dr. Mikaela Bloomberg stated.

This research underscores the cognitive benefits derived from regular physical activity and highlights the need for mindful incorporation of exercise into daily routines.
newTitle: Just One Session of Exercise Can Supercharge Your Brain Until the Next Day

title: 'Live by the spam, die by the spam': Elon Musk claps back at MAGA censorship claims on X amid H-1B visa r - The Times of India
summary:

Publication Date: October 2023, Source: Times of India

The article covers the growing tensions between Elon Musk and MAGA supporters over allegations of censorship on X, sparked by a disagreement on immigration and H-1B visas. Laura Loomer and other influencers claim they faced censorship after criticizing immigration policies.

  • Elon Musk is accused by MAGA supporters of silencing them on X after a clash regarding immigration and H-1B visas.
  • Laura Loomer claims her account was downgraded and her ability to purchase premium services was revoked after her remarks on immigration.
  • Musk responded to the accusations by tweeting about spam accounts and their consequences.
  • The controversy intensified due to Musk's defense of an Indian-American appointed as an AI policy adviser.
  • The debate involves various MAGA figures and highlights a rift within the supporters over immigration issues.
“I have now also been banned from being able to purchase premium. We are always told to buy premium. But if you criticize immigration, you get your premium check taken away and also get banned from buying Premium. Pure censorship. MAGA has been silenced.” - Laura Loomer

The ongoing feud illustrates deeper divisions within the MAGA community concerning immigration and highlights Musk's controversial stance on the issue.

Date: Dec 28, 2024 12:42 AM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

Rapper OG Maco has died at the age of 32, two weeks after a self-inflicted gunshot wound. He was surrounded by family at a Los Angeles hospital when he passed away, according to reports.

  • OG Maco was known for his song “U Guessed It.”
  • His family shared a heartfelt statement on X, reflecting on his life and impact.
  • Maco had been admitted to the hospital on December 12 due to the gunshot wound.
  • He was found unresponsive at his home after a gunshot was reported by a neighbor.
  • The rapper was in a coma and his condition deteriorated over the following days.
“Through his music, passion, and unwavering spirit, he touched so many lives and left a lasting impact.” – Family Statement

Blood transfusions can help save heart attack patients with anemia: Study - The Times of India
summary:
Blood transfusions can help save heart attack patients with anemia: Study

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: NEJM Evidence

A recent study indicates that blood transfusions are life-saving for anemic individuals after a heart attack, showing a reduced risk of death within six months for those receiving more transfusions.

  • Anemia affects about one-third of congestive heart failure cases and raises heart attack risk.
  • Patients with fewer transfusions had a 9.3% death rate within 30 days compared to 8.1% for those receiving more transfusions.
  • Heart-related deaths were 5.5% for fewer transfusions vs. 3.7% for those with more transfusions.
  • Over 4,300 patients' data from four trials were analyzed for the study.
“The results of this analysis show that giving more blood to anemic patients with heart attacks can save lives at six months.” - Dr. Jeffrey Carson

While blood transfusions can significantly benefit anemic heart attack patients, caution is advised due to potential risks such as infection or fluid buildup.
newTitle: Study Shows Blood Transfusions Benefit Anemic Heart Attack Patients

title: Bird flu mutation detected in Louisiana patient, risk low: US health agency - Business Standard
summary:
Bird Flu Mutation Detected in Louisiana Patient, Risk Low: US Health Agency

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Business Standard

A genetic analysis shows that the bird flu virus has mutated inside a Louisiana patient, who contracted the first severe case in the U.S. The CDC indicates that while the mutations are concerning, the public risk remains low.

  • The Louisiana patient is over 65 years old with underlying health issues.
  • There has been no known transmission of the virus to others.
  • The CDC reassures that the risk to the general public from the outbreak has not changed.
  • Scientific experts emphasize the need to monitor such mutations carefully.
“We know that the pandemic clock is ticking. We just don’t know what time it is.” - Michael Osterholm

The incident highlights the ongoing concerns regarding potential influenza pandemics, advising vigilance in monitoring avian viruses and their mutations.
newTitle: Bird Flu Mutation Detected in Louisiana Patient, Risk Low: US Health Agency
